Aprilia Tuono test ride

July 5th, 2004 · No Comments

I got to test ride an Aprilia Tuono yesterday. Chris S graciously offered a ride on his when he noticed I was test riding several European bikes. The leading contender for my next bike is the Triumph Speed Triple which is very similar to the Tuono in that it is a naked sport bike known for its wheelie-inducing torque. I was also idly considering Tuono since (1) there is one for sale locally; (2) I live quite near to a fantastic Aprilia repair place; and (3) the very positive reviews in the magazines.

I have ridden a S3 so here’s my comparison:

1) The inline-3 Triumph engine is smoother. Feels closer to an inline-4 than the big boom of the v-twin Tuono. The Tuono has a scary amount of power - I don’t think I ever got it above 7k and in second gear it wanted to power wheelie at that point. It is REAL easy to make the front-end go light with just a little too much throttle - I was very glad to see a steering dampener stock on the Tuono because this thing is a tankslapper magnet. The bike ran cool, no problems with engine heat.
2) The Tuono’s gear shift can be difficult. It had several thousand miles so I’m worried this is a permanent condition. The S3’s was clunky but so was my SV’s until after a thousand miles or so.
3) Ergos on both bikes are pretty similar. Both have a slight forward cant but are much more upright that a true sportbike.
4) I found the Tuono’s dash difficult to read and not pretty to look at. The rest of the bike is usually considered “love it or hate it” but I like its “edgy” look.
5) The Tuono’s tank has an odd, thin shape like the current Ducatis. It’s not good or bad, just different than the rounder shape on my SV and the S3.

Handling and brakewise, I didn’t notice anything out of place. I wasn’t about to push it on unfamiliar roads on an expensive unfamiliar bike so this is not surprising. Chris S compared it to a big dirt bike and I think that is the most appropriate analogy. It didn’t take over the S3’s spot at the top of my list but it is still a very fun and cool streetfighter.
